website_summaries.verdict: A good blend of 12 all-natural ingredients that will attract a wide variety of birds.
pros: Contains 50% sunflowers, along with 7 different seeds, 3 varieties of nuts, and cracked corn with no fillers
cons: A few issues with spoiled bags containing mold, fungus, or other contaminants

customer_reviews.title: One bag was great, one bag was foul.
customer_reviews.text: The first bag I ordered was a 5 Star, not too much millet, the birds loved it and it seemed fresh. The second bag was less tha a 1 Star (see photo) as the unopened package seems to contain a fungus or something. In any case, it’s unusable.
customer_reviews.author: S.A.H.

customer_reviews.title: Infested w bug residue
customer_reviews.text: The apparently undamaged bag was filled with cobwebs, like meal-worms or spiderwebs. Return policy asks I send back the infestation vs throwing out - ick in the mail. I don't want in around my house until Monday.
customer_reviews.author: Rob and Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Less waste
customer_reviews.text: Many of the less expensive brands that I was purchasing at Walmart contained great quantities of red milo. No animal seems to eat this. I have chipmunks, squirrels, rabbits, and a possum who frequently feed in my yard and NONE eat red milo. So I was simply sweeping up a good deal of the feed and throwing it away. This feed contains no red milo and very little is left behind to clean up from my patio. It's a bit expensive by comparison, but lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: T. Woodward

customer_reviews.title: High quality, top of the line
customer_reviews.text: This here is the best all-around birdseed from everything from Dark-eyed Juncos to Doves (Mourning, White-Winged and invasive Eurasian Collared, invasive European Starlings, invasive House Sparrow, Cardinals, Bluejays, Mockingbirds, Brown Thrashers, Red-bellied Woodpeckers, etc. If purchased between $22 to $25 for 20 lbs or $40 to $45 for 40 lbs it is a good value. But Amazon, as soon as the SARS-CoV-2 virus went pandemic they start price gouging everything and at $35 for 20 lbs I went shopping someplace else. Now the price has return to normal but the damage was done. Side note Lyric was completely shut down, meaning no product. But that did not cause or large retail company to rip people off.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Less waste. More of the good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: This is what good bird seed should look like. Plenty of variety in sunflower, corn, peanuts, regular seed, and maybe just a smidgen of waste in the form of wood chips. Look at this mix! This is exactly as I pulled it out of the bag and put it into my container. Look at all those sunflower seeds! The birds are going to absolutely love this, and again, I have to look at the amount of waste and filler that is absent in this bag versus another competitor. You got my business.
customer_reviews.author: R. Simon

customer_reviews.title: Good Blend that a Vast Host of Birds Enjoy
customer_reviews.text: Another really good bird seed blend that our wild birds love. Hmmm, even the squirrels love it. Well, even the local raccoon love it. So, I guess that I have found a product that is perfect for our many critters that come to our back yard. Heck, even the dog tried eating it. Seriously, this seed attracted a wide range of birds and it makes for a fun bird watching experience in our little neck of the woods. We have five acres of wooded land so we have lots of birds and then brings the majority of them out and too our feeders.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Curnutt

customer_reviews.title: Bag was torn and spilled
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a gift for my uncle to accompany a bird feeder. When I lifted the bag out of the Amazon box, it had a rip in the bottom and bird seed spilled out onto my floor. There were seeds in the box that had spilled out during transit as well. I do not want to gift my uncle a broken bag of bird seed, so this was annoying. Also has a pretty strong, distinct smell of bird feed which is expected but not quite pleasant or wanted in an NYC apartment.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS

customer_reviews.title: It's a decent all around blend but....
customer_reviews.text: I bought one bag of this when the price went down by 50%. It's a fair product with quite a bit of millet and cracked corn which some birds do eat. From my observations, mostly ground feeding types will eat both of those. I put it in a popular hopper and a small platform style feeder which are usually emptied quickly. The peanuts are taken as well as the sunflower bits, etc. The hopper feeder is still 3/4 full after 5 days. I will likely not buy again as I prefer to mix my own.
customer_reviews.author: Gilded Lily

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised: The Birds Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Birds love it! We now get oak titmice, scrub jay, mourning doves, black phoebes and the usual visitors. Downsides? The small white seeds seem to be the least favorite of the squirrels and larger birds so they end up on the ground and sprout weeds so that’s the only downside. Also, the squirrels really like this too especially the peanuts and sunflower seeds it seems. I know this works really well because there are less birds around when it needs to be refilled. :)
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Sooo many sunflower seeds
customer_reviews.text: Great mix. Very popular. But not enough seeds like millet. So many sunflower seeds, had to use twice as much. First time I killed a 20lb bag in under a month. Squirrels very happy. Munched on sunflowers amidst a sea of birds looking for lunch. The peanuts I buy for them were barely touched. Blue Jays snagged the extra peanuts. Great mix if you want sunflower. Would absolutely try Lyric again. Was the 1st seed bag that was almost as thick as a contractors garbage bag. Quality good too, just not the mix, my mix of birds wanted.
customer_reviews.author: J&J

customer_reviews.title: Lyrics No Waste IS a waste of your $$$!
customer_reviews.text: Thinking of upgrading the offering in the backyard feeders from WalMarts best, I researched various seed mixes, deciding to purchase the Lyric No Waste. Although there were several negative reviews, thought I’d roll the dice and hope for the best. Yuck! I could have paid far less at WalMart AND gotten WAY far less webs! The worst thing about Lyrics No Waste aside from the webs and pest-nibbled seeds was the WASTE of $$$!
customer_reviews.author: SJD

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional
customer_reviews.text: Highest quality feed I have found. No dust, sticks or stuff in the bag. Very nice mix and much easier than trying to make my own. A flock of pinon jays discovered it and have been eating everything in sight. Quail and small birds enjoy it too so I guess the variety works for everybody. I will probably add some straight sunflower seed to extend it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Korody

customer_reviews.title: Good Bird Seed But Squirrels Seem To Like It Too
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go along with a bird feeder that I bought as a gift for my Mothers cat for Christmas. I am not an expert with birds or bird seed but it went along well with the bird feeder and the birds do like this bird seed. The only drawback is that some of the squirrels like this birdseed too. This really isn't too much of a negative for us because the squirrels entertain the cat just as much as the birds. This may be a negative for some buyers of this bird seed though. For our use I would give this product 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: b63dd176

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mix at a very good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a much better than average bird seed mix and a good value at the price being charged which is $4 less than what the local hardware and feed stores charge and I need to drive to pick it up. The birds love it too as is evident by the rate at which they consume it.
customer_reviews.author: WinterTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Poor products
customer_reviews.text: The last time I got a Lyric product it had cobwebs and moths in the sealed bag not noticed until I opened it. I decided it was probably a bad batch and I ordered this new Lyric product. Unfortunately after opening it I once again have moth webs in the bag which shows the product is not handled correctly before being bagged. I am not going to tape up an open bag and mail it back to the maker to possibly get another infested bag, so I will pursue a different manufacturer in the future.
customer_reviews.author: dallmodog

customer_reviews.title: The birds love it!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first time I've bought this bird seed and the birds have just loved it! I wasn't getting much action with the previous bird seed I had, so I put this one out and have had as many as 9 birds waiting for their turn at the feeder. Finches, blue jays, cardinals and other kinds I haven't identified yet. The squirrels have also enjoyed it a few times! All the birds seem happy and keep coming back over and over again, so I'd say they like it!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin McLamb

customer_reviews.title: Never buy again
customer_reviews.text: This bird seed had gads upon gads if I don’t know what mixed in with it.... looked like the sweepings from factory floor... or spider webs matted in grey dust... looked like shredded stringy tissue paper Made of something organic... I had to clean it out every time I scooped a can full out b4 I could put in my feeders.... handfuls upon handfuls if the stuff...
customer_reviews.author: kim auburn

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mixed-seed product so I can get yelled at by even more birds when the feeder's empty... yay! *sigh* I am not very good at identifying birds, but I know I have attracted mourning doves, pigeons, cardinals, grackles, redwing blackbirds, at least one woodpecker, ducks from the pond next door, bluejays and finches (I live in N. Alabama).
customer_reviews.author: Speed

customer_reviews.title: Quality Seed
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this seed! It really is as good as they say. Lots of sunflower seeds and nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Came infested with cobwebs and black mildew, very smelly
customer_reviews.text: Still waiting for my refund, I had to return this bag super smelly in the mail, looking at it in the box it was all black with mildew and had been taped at the top, seeds were spilling out everywhere! I had to sent it back like that in the mail, the poor Fedex workers! Will update my review once I get my refund back. Update: They DID refund my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: BIRDS WON'T EAT THE WHITE FILLER.
customer_reviews.text: As with all the various bird seeds I have tried, this one's no better. Whatever the little white Styrofoam-like kernels are used as fillers, the birds reject them and won't continue to feed until I run my finger around the tray to dump it all on the ground. What a waste.!!! Anyone know what that white crap is?
customer_reviews.author: laura hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Great mix.
customer_reviews.text: Living in the country my guys have lots of choices. I have fruit trees also, its cute to find a fig or piece of pear left in a tray with the seeds. It’s a buffet! No waste, someone will clean up what others drop. Have been very satisfied ,purchased multiple times. 20lb bag only lasts a month tho, big eaters!
customer_reviews.author: squishy

customer_reviews.title: Happy Birds. Happy Bird Watchers.
customer_reviews.text: On behalf of the many birds in our neighborhood, thank you and three cheers. They all seem to love it and we love having so many more guests at our feeders. The squirrels, which we love, are getting fatter by the day. Cardinals, bluejays and a broad selection of finches and other songbirds have made our yard their favorite hangout.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Helm

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with this bird mix is that the birds love it so much, I have to reorder it so often!
customer_reviews.author: ultragolden

customer_reviews.title: The birds love it.
customer_reviews.text: We have tried many types of bird seed and usually the results are good. Having said that birds consistently love Lyric Supreme. It attracts a nice mix of birds in our small feeders. Even Bluebirds like it in the South during late Winter when both bugs and natural seeds are scarce.
customer_reviews.author: Gandalf

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it
customer_reviews.text: I tried Lyric Supreme and was pleasantly surprised. I'm guessing our bird visitors have at least doubled. There's very little waste and no powder. We see a lot of cardinals, woodpeckers, titmice, doves, brown Thrashers, mocking birds, catbird, painted bunting, finches, wrens and assorted others. I usually use about 20lb+ per month here in Orlando. Also deer squirrels and raccoons like it.
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH  Biela

customer_reviews.title: Great product - but now too expensive
customer_reviews.text: An excellent wild bird food mix that we had on our subscription list and was reasonably priced. Now that the cost has more than doubled we had to drop it and go with another mix.
customer_reviews.author: Len Peruski

customer_reviews.title: Bugs in the seeds
customer_reviews.text: Opened this bag and was greeted by bugs and worms 🐛. This was a 40 pound bag that had to all be thrown away. I’m disappointed the birds are disappointed and now where do I get a clean fresh bag of this seed without worry of something eating the seeds before the birds do. Not to mention what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ottens

customer_reviews.title: Sent the wrong mix
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered the Wild Bird Mix several times now, and the birds love it, and I was very satisfied. However, on this repeat order, they erroneously sent me a 20 pound bag of Fruit and Nut blend. The birds still like that, when they can get it, but the pieces are so large they clog up the feeder, and I must clear it out several times a day. I’m still trying to make do, but it is problematic. I’d have given this a higher rating if the order had been accurately fulfilled.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Mostly happy with product
customer_reviews.text: I wish the bag had a handle and a zip closure; that would make the price easier to swallow. Otherwise, it's a very nice mixture, and the birds love it. Also, fine packaging and delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Zorro

customer_reviews.title: Too much millet!
customer_reviews.text: All my birds won’t eat the tiny B.B. like filler. Is this millet?
customer_reviews.author: Roger D. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Blue Jays like it
customer_reviews.text: For some reason or another, only blue jays have been eating this - and squirrels try awfully hard to reach it. The jays by stop by several times a day. I can't tell if the problem lies with this feed or not, but I am nonetheless happy to feed the jays. I'll update my review if any other birds come along.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Birds like and seeds grew wild flowers
customer_reviews.text: The birds seem to like this! We used it this summer and only got brown sparrows but we live in an urban environment. What I find most amusing is the fact that where the animals ate and discarded their seeds and shells I now have wildflowers like queen Ann's lace growing!
customer_reviews.author: dl

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: While there are a few pieces of sticks, the basic seed mix is good and the birds have shown no hesitation in accepting this feed instead of the blend i was feeding them previously. That's a win in my book, and this bag works out to be a bit less than what I was spending.
customer_reviews.author: Xanlthorpe

customer_reviews.title: Local birds love this mix. Arrived timely.
customer_reviews.text: I live in the foothills of northern California, and my local birds really enjoy this mix. Arrived timely.
customer_reviews.author: Rozan L. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this particular product from Lebanon Seaboard.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second bag I've ordered. The first was very powdery as if some of the product in the bag had been ground. This bag was full of mold. The other bird seed I have purchased from them has been fine.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping in STL

customer_reviews.title: This seed brings all the birds to the yard.
customer_reviews.text: After reading quite a few disheartening reviews I reluctantly decided to give this seed a try. I have not been disappointed. I went through this entire bag in 2 weeks. The birds in my yard absolutely love this stuff. If you're looking for a large affordable bag of seed that the birds can't get enough of. This is your bird seed!
customer_reviews.author: AK Squidsauce

customer_reviews.title: Birds Like It
customer_reviews.text: This blend attracts many different birds with very little wasted seeds (no milo!).... Good value since almost all the seeds are eaten. I especially like it for the winter birds in Florida as it has white proso millet which Painted Buntings love.
customer_reviews.author: Divinity Love

customer_reviews.title: ... spreading among the birds in our neighborhood -- they love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: The word is spreading among the birds in our neighborhood -- they love this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Jan

customer_reviews.title: Birds never grew
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this is false advertising. I planted these in soil and watered them for weeks and I got some plants but not a single bird grew.
customer_reviews.author: NoHinAmherst

customer_reviews.title: Large clump of......in wild bird seed
customer_reviews.text: Large clump in bag of wild bird seed. Not sure what it is but don’t want to get my birds sick.......I’ve purchased many times in the past with no issues but I’m now very wary and will certainly throw this in garbage. Very unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: BonsterAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bird seed
customer_reviews.text: good seed mix All the birds like it and say complimentary things regarding this wonderful mix of gourmet seed Also all the undesirable animals love to chow down too
customer_reviews.author: Royal J. Langley

customer_reviews.title: Birds Love this Mix!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy that I found Lyric Supreme Wild Bird Mix from this seller at Amazon. Not only have I saved $10 on what my local garden shop sells it for – the birds love it. Not a lot of extraneous filler and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: MDFoodie

customer_reviews.title: Best price for quality Bird Seed mix
customer_reviews.text: Best price for this Bird Seed mix when price near $40! If you have squirrels do not let heavy delivery box stay outside, they can quickly eat through box and bag to get to seed
customer_reviews.author: al

customer_reviews.title: Cannot keep enough of this seed in the bird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This birdseed has much less millet than other brands and has a good variety of seeds, nuts and corn. The birds absolutely love this mix!
customer_reviews.author: Joanie Leverett

customer_reviews.title: Webs and Bugs!
customer_reviews.text: The first bag of Lyric Supreme Wild Bird Mix - 20 lb. I was very happy with the great mix! The second bag I bought, when I opened it, had white webs and bugs! What a waste of money & food for my birds. I will not be buying Lyric brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: so much wasted product
customer_reviews.text: Birds just kick most of this to the ground out of the feeders. Waste of money will not buy again. Some sunflower seeds but mostly unappetizing seed to my birds here in NW.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for wild birds
customer_reviews.text: I bought a regular bird seed at my local store and noticed no birds were coming to my feeder. I decided to try this "wild bird" seed and it has been amazing. So many birds come all day long, they even fight over my bird feeder. It truly does have 50% sunflower seeds and huge chunks of peanuts, corn and dried fruit it looks like.
customer_reviews.author: RhymesWithPizza

customer_reviews.title: Good variety of birds
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how quickly these seeds went. First bird feeder and first bag of seeds I tried but I got blue jays, cardinals and doves that finished this bag off in a week. Only downfall is the price. The variety of birds it attracted was impressive though.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good seed choice. Will reorder.
customer_reviews.text: Good blend of seeds, especially for the price. We will order this item again in lieu of the previously favored Nut n Fruit Blend at twice the price. Bag has handle on one end which makes carrying and pouring a snap.
customer_reviews.author: F. Tippett

customer_reviews.title: I have been visited by a wider variety of birds ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been visited by a wider variety of birds. I keep it in a tray feeder just outside my kitchen window.
customer_reviews.author: Carol70

customer_reviews.title: whats up
customer_reviews.text: i do not know why none of dozens of different birds will not eat these seeds, we have quail, finches, blue jays,crows and others. i am at 2400 ft. in the foothills or fresno and madera co. ca.
customer_reviews.author: lonny tannenbaum

customer_reviews.title: Great bird seed
customer_reviews.text: I think I've reviewed this before. All of the varieties of Lyric bird seed are no waste and draw an incredible number of birds. Love all their bird seed products.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Sher

customer_reviews.title: wrong product shipped twice
customer_reviews.text: 3 time ordered, last 2 box indicates "supreme" but box contained "delite". Would rather get "supreme" though best value getting "delite"...be aware when ordering
customer_reviews.author: MusingMoney

customer_reviews.title: Attracts a wide range of birds, good quality seed!
customer_reviews.text: I am on my 3rd bag of this and it is very good. It has attracted a wide range of birds to my garden, including the one pictured on the bag! I highly recommend this as a good mix for feeding and scattering. Some of it has seeded in our wild patch and I look forward to seeing what grows from the seedlings! I supplement this with some peanuts in their shell and some flax for smaller birds.
customer_reviews.author: Alice W

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Although I have not tried the product the visual I got is very pleasing and the birds and the squirrels are thankful everyday. I will buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Mack

customer_reviews.title: Indiana birds love
customer_reviews.text: Birds seem very happy with this mix. Noticeable increase in how long the birds stay and eat. Live in central Indiana and have a nice mixture of birds.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Keck

customer_reviews.title: Birds love this
customer_reviews.text: I get finches, catbirds, cardinals, woodpeckers and even a bluebird. They eat it all up! This is my go to bird seed and I feel like I got a great deal on it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to being worth this current price
customer_reviews.text: Why did the price of this suddenly double within the past 2 weeks? Seems like a pretty good way to scam people who submit regular re-orders on autopilot.
customer_reviews.author: ryesteve

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Birds are enjoying very much. So far Cardinals, Blue Jays, Chickadee, Juncos and sparrows. (And 1 squirrel is trying very hard!)
customer_reviews.author: Maureen N. Swearingen

customer_reviews.title: The birds love it!
customer_reviews.text: The birds love it! Have had this seed for only about 3 weeks, i get a wide variety of birds here in kentucky using this mix. Tufted titmouse, chickadee, cardinals, finches, doves, yellow bellied woodpeckers, blue jays and sadly even squirrels.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Banning

customer_reviews.title: WIldbirds from my backyard love it especially the squirrels
customer_reviews.text: This bird mix is very good except for the huge amounts of sesame seeds in it. The squirrels love it. Which is good cuz the birds don't like the sesame seeds they can not open them.
customer_reviews.author: Zenjon

customer_reviews.title: money wasted
customer_reviews.text: The birds I feed outside did not touch this seed. In fact, I finally spread it out on the back s ide of my 1acre yard
customer_reviews.author: Mary P

customer_reviews.title: It may seem pricey, but it's worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Attracts a wide variety of birds to my garden. It's the only brand I buy because it has no fillers such as red millet which east coast birds do not eat.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Blue

customer_reviews.title: Bird seed infested with bugs
customer_reviews.text: The product was infested with moths and it’s Larve....after emptying the contents into my container I counted at least a dozen moths and many Larve about 1 inch long. I will not buy this again from Amazon and will purchase at a local retailer.
customer_reviews.author: David E Ferens

customer_reviews.title: Our birds are not eating it
customer_reviews.text: No birds have eaten them, but when they blow out of the feeder, we have sunflowers growing up all around it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on first floor and I live on 3rd floor. No elevator 83 and knee surgery cancelled!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne F Brawley

customer_reviews.title: Great seed mix!
customer_reviews.text: Seed mix is clean of debris, seeds and grains only-well worth the money. Birds come in flocks to eat this-very little mess left after they eat.
customer_reviews.author: S. Maddox

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very different from the last time I ordered this. Its all sunflower seed and white millet and hardly anything else. I'm using it but its not going over well. I can see them tossing out the white millet to find the sunflower seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene C.

customer_reviews.title: Totally infested with worms!
customer_reviews.text: I opened my first bag to a lot of silk webbing in the bag. I then opened up the second bag and it was the same. I dumped them in an air tight container for two weeks. I opened them up today to find HUNDREDS of worms and the entire containers filled with the webs and worms! Food is unusable! So sad, because Lyric bird food is all I use. I'm going to have to try to find a different brand this year.
customer_reviews.author: janelle

customer_reviews.title: Great bird seed!
customer_reviews.text: Great bird seed; the wild birds loved it! I had some very beautiful birds visiting my feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara W.

customer_reviews.title: Birds luv it :-)
customer_reviews.text: Cardinals, finches, chickadees, mourning doves, wood peckers......they all luv this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Archambault-Shaw

customer_reviews.title: bird seed
customer_reviews.text: Lots of nuts - I mix it with fruit birdseed and the birds and squirrels have a gourmet meal everyday
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great feed
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the doves on my back patio gutter. Other birds eat out of it, and of course the doves eat off the patio. I see birds there all throughout the day, returning for more.
customer_reviews.author: Adragontitan

customer_reviews.title: Product came as described
customer_reviews.text: Product came as described, although i did learn its much cheaper to buy bird feed at a store
customer_reviews.author: RWeidlich

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Old seed filled with cobwebs and bugs!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! Old product and now I have to pay to ship it back???? I have purchased this before and it was good seed which attracted a variety of birds, BUT this seed was filled with cobwebs and bugs and seemed old! SADLY. A Very expensive purchase and a waste of money...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Birdseed is contaminated.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike this bird seed because it had mold, or some type of webs in it. I bought several bags, and this one had been in my house until 3 days ago. I can’t use it because of not knowing if it will kill the birds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: birds so as squirrels both loved them
customer_reviews.text: Attracted all sorts of birds so as squirrels. You have to have hanging strategy to avoid the squirrel attacks.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Wang

customer_reviews.title: The birds love it
customer_reviews.text: The birds love it: sparrows, finches, chickadees, blue jays, cardinals, nuthatches, tufted titmouses all come to my feeder.
customer_reviews.author: L. Goedecke

customer_reviews.title: A mix that all birds seem to love.
customer_reviews.text: Birds love this mix. Large birds pull all the seed out of the feeder to get to the peanuts. I added a separate feeder fish for large birds with peanuts.
customer_reviews.author: G Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Good feef
customer_reviews.text: Birds seem to like it and unfortunately the squirrels too!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine & Jim

customer_reviews.title: happy birds
customer_reviews.text: The birds love it-doves, wrens, mockingbirds, cardinals.... They go thru 5 lbs in a week! This is my 2nd order and I order multiple bags each time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it
customer_reviews.text: I guess the flavor is good because the birds and squirrels are flocking to the feeders.
customer_reviews.author: Hillcat

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended -insect laden bird seed mix
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. Found Dust and insects in the seed mix. Disgusting. I don’t know if it was just this Lyric batch but I won’t buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Consumer

customer_reviews.title: I was initially worried based on some bad reviews but I've found this to be the cheapest ...
customer_reviews.text: I was initially worried based on some bad reviews but I've found this to be the cheapest blend available and with no quality issues in 2 bags. I think it's almost identical to Wagner's Greatest Variety blend but cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Sleephartha

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice sized bag. Looks to be good quality bird seed for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Nettispagetti

customer_reviews.title: Lyric Supreme attracts many different birds - and they love it!
customer_reviews.text: Always great quality seed blends from Lyric - the birds just love it. Nice mix of seeds with Supreme, attracts so many different birds
customer_reviews.author: MUBALL

customer_reviews.title: Its a hit with the birds
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only seen sparrows come by, but they seem to come often and feed. So happy!
customer_reviews.author: MEENA RODKIN

customer_reviews.title: Contains filler
customer_reviews.text: The birds don't like some of the seeds. They spit the little orange seeds out and the ground below is covered with them.
customer_reviews.author: Black Dog

customer_reviews.title: Birds won’t touch it.
customer_reviews.text: Birds won’t touch it. Worst bird feed I’ve ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Attracts ALL birds!
customer_reviews.text: We have doves, woodpeckers, cardinals and blue jays in our SW Florida locale. They all love this seed - something for everyone. : )
customer_reviews.author: Joan M. Millon

customer_reviews.title: Bird Party errrry day
customer_reviews.text: On our second bag. Doves, finches, etc. They love it. We love them. Izza party.
customer_reviews.author: swafa

customer_reviews.title: Mix not being eaten by the birds
customer_reviews.text: Put the mix in the new bird feeder & so far the birds haven’t eaten any of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Susie

customer_reviews.title: Attracts a wide variety of birds!
customer_reviews.text: I love this birdseed! It attracts all kinda of birds!
customer_reviews.author: Snowgirl

customer_reviews.title: For The Birds...All Birds
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't ask for a better blend of seed. Attracts all kinds of birds and the best part....no waste. Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: DDD

customer_reviews.title: Lyric Supreme Wild Bird Mix
customer_reviews.text: Bought to reduce waste. Most of the food was wasted and the birds did not eat it. The seed and the quality was very good I think just the wrong mix. The feeder closes if a squirrel attempts to get the food. Lower Florida area.
customer_reviews.author: Erica's

customer_reviews.title: Mostly sunflower seeds
customer_reviews.text: The bag I received was almost all sunflower seeds, with very little of anything else. I was disappointed because I wanted more of a mixture of seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Hamel

customer_reviews.title: The birds love it!
customer_reviews.text: Before I started using this feed, I only had one or two birds coming to my windowsill. Now I have five or six! They love it.
customer_reviews.author: T.V.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great combination of quality bird seed and sunflower seeds and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great combination of quality bird seed and sunflower seeds and other fine ingredients to make our bird family happy and content.
customer_reviews.author: ruthieAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: my wild birds loved it
customer_reviews.text: Went crazy for the stuff, ate everything, never any leftover bits.
customer_reviews.author: L. C.

product_meta.title: Lyric 2647414 Supreme Wild Bird Mix - 4.5 lb.
product_meta.description: Size:4.5 lb.Lyric Supreme is our most popular wild bird food. We selected a wide variety of all natural, tested ingredients to attract feeder birds like finches, clinging birds who like nuts like woodpeckers and nuthatches and ground feeders like doves. We have large seeds like black oil sunflower for cardinals and small seeds like white millet for juncos. Lyric Supreme is the preferred mix of backyard birders for many reasons. Supreme has a wide variety of the finest natural nutrients with hand-crafted quality and is created by long-time bird feeding hobbyists. Try Supreme by Lyric with the finest nutrients, you'll see the difference.
feature_bullets: Nutritional mix with 7 different seeds, 3 varieties of nuts, sunflower kernels and cracked corn
Contains over 50% sunflower seeds and nuts
Guaranteed to attract the widest variety of wild birds
This mix features 12 all natural, hand-crafted, high-quality ingredients with no fillers
Attracts finches, woodpeckers, chickadees, nuthatches, cardinals, doves, juncos, jays and many more

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
